reviews.text:
Fantastic day out. Lots very helpful staff, including volunteers - who are more than happy to stop and chat, and explain the workings.. Drivers welcome you into the cab and explain how the engine works, the same with the signalman, inviting you into the signal box - explaining the operation of signals and points.

It was a shame that they've closed access to the workshops - although understandable on safety grounds... They do provide viewing galleries though, various exhibits.

Had a good afternoon and evening riding the train and stayed for the RAT (Real Ale Train). Good selection of beers and great fun having a mini beer festival on a moving train, will do it again though may get local accommodation to avoid my wife having to drive me back to West London with a belly full of beer.
Perhaps the railway could set up a deal with one of the B&B,s in the town?

A wonderful throwback to the golden age of steam. The steam engines, carriages and buildings all lovingly restored and maintained. The volunteer staff are helpful and enthusiastic.
The journey through the beautiful Hampshire countryside makes this heritage railway well worth a visit.
You should break your journey at Ropley to visit the engine sheds and engineering workshops.
This is a wonderful day out. There are preserved locamotives and rolling stock. The station buildings are atmospheric and kept pristine. Altogether a most enjoyable experience to be had.
Even though we had a wet day it was a very enjoyable one. Plenty to see, very helpful people. A great day out.
